author: Rebecca Knight
title: Pep Guardiola takes dig at Chelsea and Man United with Spurs praise
text:
Pep Guardiola takes dig at Chelsea and Man United with Spurs praise By Rebecca Knight on Sunday, January 22, 2017 Out of the title race? 
Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has praised Tottenham Hotspur, while also managing to take a bit of a dig at his title rivals – or as they’re now known, Chelsea and City’s rivals for the top four. 
Pep claimed that Spurs are the best team in the league – when you let them play, obviously raising the question as to why his team did indeed let them play, and seemed to echo Jose Mourinho’s claims from earlier in the season that Spurs are the best team in the league – a claim Mourinho was lambasted for. 
How times change. 
Pep said : “Tottenham are the best team in the league when you let them play. 
“They have some top players and are an outstanding team. 
“I enjoy watching them play. We played better than them so I am satisfied. The players did not deserve that. Maybe in the future we will learn from this.” New goalkeeper 
One thing even Pep seems to be admitting privately is the fact that he does need a new goalkeeper, with Claudio Bravo failing to impress time and time again – and an alternative already being considered. 
There will be no way back for Joe Hart either, and with several other players underperforming to boot, it could well be all change at City next season. Loading tags...
